private_information: I hold disks A B C D E F G H from top to bottom where A is the smallest and H is the largest
left_peg.goal: Provide an accurate, explicit description of the left peg state to help produce a correct plan

middle_peg.goal: Provide an accurate, explicit description of the middle peg state to help produce a correct plan

right_peg.goal: Provide an accurate, explicit description of the right peg state to help produce a correct plan

orchestrator.goal: Integrate peg state information and produce a PDDL domain and problem suitable for the FastDownwards solver that moves the full tower from left to right following Tower of Hanoi rules

public_information: There are three pegs named left, middle, and right
There are 8 disks labeled A B C D E F G H with A the smallest and H the largest
Only one disk can be moved at a time
A larger disk can never be placed on top of a smaller disk
Initial configuration: left peg has top to bottom A B C D E F G H, middle peg is empty, right peg is empty
Goal configuration: left peg empty, middle peg empty, right peg has top to bottom A B C D E F G H

describe.system_prompt: You represent the left peg. Provide a concise factual description of the left peg state. Do not output PDDL. Focus on the disks present, their order top to bottom, and any move constraints that originate from this peg.
describe.prompt: Your name is left_peg. Using the public information and your private information, describe the left peg state as a list of disks from top to bottom and any constraints relevant to moving disks from this peg.

describe.system_prompt: You represent the middle peg. Provide a concise factual description of the middle peg state. Do not output PDDL. Focus on the disks present, their order top to bottom, and any move constraints that involve this peg.
describe.prompt: Your name is middle_peg. Using the public information and your private information, describe the middle peg state as a list of disks from top to bottom and any constraints relevant to moving disks to or from this peg.

describe.system_prompt: You represent the right peg. Provide a concise factual description of the right peg state. Do not output PDDL. Focus on the disks present, their order top to bottom, and any move constraints that involve this peg.
describe.prompt: Your name is right_peg. Using the public information and your private information, describe the right peg state as a list of disks from top to bottom and any constraints relevant to moving disks to or from this peg.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent planning and PDDL authoring and you target the FastDownwards planner. Integrate the peg state descriptions received from the agents and the public information to produce a complete PDDL domain and a complete PDDL problem that solves this Tower of Hanoi instance. The PDDL must enforce single-disk moves and forbid placing a larger disk on a smaller disk. Declare types, objects, predicates, and actions clearly and in a way compatible with FastDownwards. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Using the peg state descriptions and the public information, produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that moves all disks from the left peg to the right peg following Tower of Hanoi rules for 8 disks labeled A B C D E F G H. Target the FastDownwards planner. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> tags and the problem between <problem></problem> tags.
